Class Fish

java.lang.Object
  OceanObject
      Fish
All Implemented Interfaces:
Actor
Direct Known Subclasses:
Groper, Herring, Shark
public abstract class Fish
extends OceanObject
implements Actor

The abstract parent class for all other types of fish. Stores variables common to all fish such as age and hunger and establishes methods for shared behaviours, uses abstract methods where subtype specific behaviours are required.

Version:
15/11/2010
Author:
Matthew Maglennon

Fish

protected Fish()
Constructor for objects of class Fish. Performs construction applicable to all subclasses of fish. Only subclasses can call Fish constructors.

protected Fish(java.lang.Boolean randomAge,

Parameters:

Method Detail

setAge

protected void setAge(int age)
Sets the age variable of a fish to the input.

Parameters:
age - Desired age of the fish.

setRandomMaxAge

protected void setRandomMaxAge()
Gives the fish a random maximum age variable based on the average maximum age of its species. 80% to 120%

act

public final java.lang.String act(Ocean currentOcean,
                                  Ocean updatedOcean,
                                  java.util.List<Actor> newFish)
The fish is told to act. All fish perform the same types of actions. They increase in age, increase in hunger, attempt to breed and decided where to move.

Specified by:
act in interface Actor
Parameters:
currentOcean - Reference to the current ocean.
updatedOcean - Reference to the updated ocean.
newFish - A list of actors in which to store new born fish.
Returns:
Returns the fishes thoughts during its actions.

lookAround

protected java.util.List<Location> lookAround()
A fish looks around and returns its adjacent locations

Returns:
A list of locations adjacent to the fishes location.

decideOnMovement

protected Location decideOnMovement(java.util.List<Location> surroundings)
A fish decides where to move in a preferential order. First priority is finding food, second is finding a preferred location, third is staying in its current location. If a fish can neither move nor stay it dies of overcrowding.

Parameters:
surroundings - A list of locations around the fish.
Returns:
The location a fish wants to move to. Will be null if fish dies.

chooseNextLocation

protected abstract Location chooseNextLocation(java.util.List<Location> surroundings)
Abstract methods unique to each subtype of fish.

findLocationOfFood

protected abstract Location findLocationOfFood(java.util.List<Location> surroundings)

move

protected void move(Location location)
A fish modifies its location and adapts the current and updated ocean accordingly NOTE: Fish must inform the current ocean of their leaving, otherwise they can still be seen as food for nearby fish.

Parameters:
location - The new location of the fish.

increaseHunger

protected void increaseHunger()
Increases a fishes hunger by 10. If hunger reaches above a fishes stamina it will die of starvation.

decreaseHunger

protected void decreaseHunger(int amount)
Decreases a fishes hunger by a given amount.

Parameters:
amount - The amount to decrease hunger by.

getHunger

protected int getHunger()
Returns:
Hunger of the fish.

age

protected void age()
Increase the fishes age by 1. If the fishes ages goes above the maximum age of the fish it dies of old age.

breed

protected void breed(java.util.List<Actor> newFish)
Calculates the offspring of a fish and adds them to a list.

Parameters:
newFish - List of actors to store new born fish.

calculateBirths

protected int calculateBirths()
If a fish is old enough to breed and passes a breeding probability test it returns a random number of births based on the maximum litter size.

Returns:
Number of births.

giveBirth

                                          java.util.List<Actor> babyFishs)
                                   throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                          java.lang.IllegalAccessException
Creates new fish using class reflection and adds them to empty squares in the updatedOcean and to the list of new actors.
